unit.utterance: nišːala sunglantalla leb χabar
unit.utterance_translation: We Sanzhi people have a story.

unit.utterance: χːula aqce muza k'eb aqce muza arilla muza bik'ʷar cinijra
unit.utterance_translation: There is a tall summit, it is called the noon summit.

unit.utterance: ar deʁibqːella debʁalla hextːu bari habeʁardele, debʁalla birq'iri
unit.utterance_translation: When it's noon, the prayer, when the sun goes there, (we) pray.

unit.utterance: sːaˁʡaˁte dakːʷi it zamana
unit.utterance_translation: At that time there were no clocks.

unit.utterance: debʁalla birq'an arilla muza bik'ul nišːala musːa k'eb
unit.utterance_translation: We have a place called the noon summit, the prayer summit.

unit.utterance: urχːab akːʷarre čula bahat'unne deq'a delq'anaj, tːura buqunnecabi činab birq'andaja, wallah heχtːub birq'anda daxanda
unit.utterance_translation: Without a mill the people were anxious about grinding the grain [i.e. it was difficult]; they went outside, "Where should we build (a mill)? By God, we will build it there. Let's go."

unit.utterance: tːura buqunne šːante agurre cab
unit.utterance_translation: The villagers went outside [i.e. left the village].

unit.utterance: birq'ul, birq'ul, birq'ul, birq'ul, rurger barq'iblecab, qalla musːa barq'iblecab
unit.utterance_translation: They were building, building, building, they built the channel for the water, they prepared the place for the millhouse.

unit.utterance: na barq'ible taman biχuble, ca ʡaˁχːuˁl dak'u uquncaw
unit.utterance_translation: When they had finished building, a man appeared.

unit.utterance: Allahli watkaʁibil užibcaw il, heltːub urχːab aarganne laˁk' digaj haʔible
unit.utterance_translation: Allah had sent him; he said, "The mill will not work there, go away!"

unit.utterance: salam abičːible il admi sarituquncaw
unit.utterance_translation: Not greeting them, the man passed by.

unit.utterance: waˁħ ik'ulcaw ca, cellij itil salam alukːane nišːicːe?
unit.utterance_translation: "Wah," said one, "Why did he not greet us?

unit.utterance: nušːa heštːud dirq'ul ledle, hari dawaj hitːi duqene, hitːi buqunne ca k'ʷel žahil durħuˁ ucibcaw
unit.utterance_translation: We who are here building, let us run after him!" They ran after him, and one or two young boys caught up with him.

unit.utterance: cellij, bik'ulcab, ul nišːicːe salam abičːibde, nušːa χalq' ʡaˁčil dirq'an χalq'deq'al
unit.utterance_translation: "Why," they said, "did you not greet us? We people who are working are people too [i.e. human beings]!"

unit.utterance: waˁħ, ik'ulcaw, dul bičːibda, ik'ulcaw salam ašːala hinna t'amal, ik'ulcaw, t'amabaq'ibda ašːij
unit.utterance_translation: "Wah," he said, "I greeted you, but because of the sound of your water, you did not hear."

unit.utterance: waˁħ, bik'ulcab, hinq'ar tedakːu itːud
unit.utterance_translation: "Wah," they said, "but there is no water."

unit.utterance: c'il ik'ulcaw, hin akːʷarilleb urχːab abirχʷniq'al ašːij baχere, ik'ulcaw, hin akːʷarilleb urχːab abuq'ni
unit.utterance_translation: He said, where there is no water a mill cannot be, you should know this! A mill cannot not mill where there is no water.

unit.utterance: wat', hawala urχːab birq'uldaw, ik'ulcaw, ušːali, č'anna urχːab?
unit.utterance_translation: Well, are you building a windmill?" he said, "A windmill?"

unit.utterance: akːʷadi nušːal hinna urχːab birq'ulda,
unit.utterance_translation: "No, we are not, we are building a watermill."

unit.utterance: agurre bursibcab itːi χːulatacːe iltːali, wallah hel ik'ʷiri, waˁħ hinra dikːantew ištːu bik'ul
unit.utterance_translation: They went away and told the elders. "By God, (this is what) he said." "Wah, you need water here?" they said.

unit.utterance: gurkabač'ible heltːi, barq'ibcab χːula erk'ʷlicːeb χːula erk'ʷla šːuleb urχːab
unit.utterance_translation: They went down, built the mill on the big river, next to the big river.

unit.utterance: darq'ible har cik'al čula, buq'unnecab urχːab k'apːa barq'ib cabi
unit.utterance_translation: They built everything and their mill is working, they built the [UNCLEAR].

unit.utterance: muq'luq' barq'ib cabi, hitːi kaʁible rurgerrerguda hin buq'unnecab urχːab
unit.utterance_translation: They built the channel, the water dropped down from the channel, the mill is milling.

unit.utterance: šːantalla deq'a delq'un cadi, tːura šːantalla delq'un cadi, na il kʷir kabirgulakːu urχːab, iltːaj balχul akːu hin čiriʁni
unit.utterance_translation: The villagers mill their wheat, the people from other villages mill, now they cannot stop the mill, they do not know how to turn off the water.

unit.utterance: na iltːi q'adnašːu, mallubnašːu baxulcab wallah nišːala urχːab hežitːe, kʷir kabirgul akːu buq'ancab pastajanna bik'ul
unit.utterance_translation: They go to the qadis, to the mullahs, "By God, our mill is like this, it does not stop, it mills always," they say.

unit.utterance: wallah, ik'ulcaw ca, hana karižib c'ikurili ik'ulcaw misa či bikːarre urχːab kʷirkabirganne
unit.utterance_translation: "By God," says one, "a bride who just married, if she kisses the mill, it will stop."

unit.utterance: wat', na iltːi il c'ikuri rarčːibcari, hana xadi karižibil, wallah hežitːe birq'ancab hežitːe, raše!
unit.utterance_translation: Well, they found this bride who had only just married. "By God, we have to do it like this, go!"

unit.utterance: na hel rursːilijra balχulakːuq'al il urχːab ce cabel
unit.utterance_translation: The girl also does not know what a mill is.

unit.utterance: agurre misa či bičːij raˁʡ čikaqiblecari heltːu qːuˁnqːuˁpːe bulan sarderqːibcad urχːabli buq'unne
unit.utterance_translation: She went there, bent forward to kiss the mill, while the millstone was turning, it even carried away her nose.

unit.utterance: sar derqːibcad heltːi qːuˁnqːuˁpːe huja haraj risːul ʁaˁʁ rik'ul
unit.utterance_translation: It carried away her nose [i.e. cut it off], she was crying and screaming.

unit.utterance: c'ili iltːali kaqːible q'uˁq', χːula q'uˁq' kaqːible, paˁq bik'ul, paˁq bik'ul belq'unnecab hel urχːab
unit.utterance_translation: Then they brought a hammer, (they) brought a big hammer, struck the mill and destroyed it.

unit.utterance: urχːabla maˁχʷaˁra dužiblecadi darq'ibte hitːi kadirkan
unit.utterance_translation: The [UNCLEAR] of the mill that had been made, the ones that attach,

unit.utterance: hel buq'unne bužibcabi, urk'i belnu baˁqaˁjaˁ, urk'i belnu baˁqaˁjaˁ, bik'ulcab, helra ʁina ʁina barq'ible, zaja barq'ible, urχːab zaja barq'ibcab
unit.utterance_translation: it continued to turn around. "The heart remained, hit it! The heart remained, hit it!" they said, and so they spoiled it, they destroyed the mill.

unit.utterance: wat', urχːab zaja barq'ibla hitːi na ce birq'uja iltːal, xar birʁulcab iltːal
unit.utterance_translation: After they had destroyed the mill, "Now what do we do do?" they asked.

unit.utterance: cet'le barq'ij ʡaˁʁunile, wallah bik'ulcab hin hitːir iʁan musːa birq'ancab, deq'a haderχːurre hin hitːir aʁij
unit.utterance_translation: "How must we do it? By God," they say, "in the place where the water can be turned off we will build it, so that after the wheat ends, we will turn off the water."

unit.utterance: c'il barq'ibcab hel urχːab jangi čibarq'ible, qarrerka hin hitːir iʁul sakabirxːul, barq'iblecab urχːab.
unit.utterance_translation: Then they built the mill anew, and when it was built, and they put something upstream to turn off the water; they built the mill.

unit.utterance: c'il narmalna duq'unne deq'a duq'unne dužibcad urχːabli.
unit.utterance_translation: Then the mill ground the grain normally.
